psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Jn 6,30]]The crowd said to Jesus:  "What sign can you do, that we may see and believe in you?  What can you do?
[[Jn 6,31]]Our ancestors ate manna in the desert, as it is written: 'He gave them bread from heaven to eat.'"
[[Jn 6,32]]So Jesus said to them, "Amen, amen, I say to you, it was not Moses who gave the bread from heaven; my Father gives you the true bread from heaven.
[[Jn 6,33]]For the bread of God is that which comes down from heaven and gives life to the world."
[[Jn 6,34]]So they said to him, "Sir, give us this bread always."
[[Jn 6,35]]Jesus said to them, "I am the bread of life; whoever comes to me will never hunger, and whoever believes in me will never thirst."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John

first_reading.text:
[[Ac 7,51]]Stephen said to the people, the elders, and the scribes:  "You stiff-necked people, uncircumcised in heart and ears,  you always oppose the Holy Spirit;  you are just like your ancestors.
[[Ac 7,52]]Which of the prophets did your ancestors not persecute? They put to death those who foretold the coming of the righteous one, whose betrayers and murderers you have now become.
[[Ac 7,53]]You received the law as transmitted by angels, but you did not observe it."
[[Ac 7,54]]When they heard this, they were infuriated, and they ground their teeth at him.
[[Ac 7,55]]But he, filled with the holy Spirit, looked up intently to heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God,
[[Ac 7,56]]and he said, "Behold, I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God."
[[Ac 7,57]]But they cried out in a loud voice, covered their ears, and rushed upon him together.
[[Ac 7,58]]They threw him out of the city, and began to stone him. The witnesses laid down their cloaks at the feet of a young man named Saul.
[[Ac 7,59]]As they were stoning Stephen, he called out, "Lord Jesus, receive my spirit."
[[Ac 7,60]]Then he fell to his knees and cried out in a loud voice, "Lord, do not hold this sin against them"; and when he said this, he fell asleep.
[[Ac 8,1a]]Now Saul was consenting to his execution.
first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles
